intro: Ornithogalum comosum, commonly known as the star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is often cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine.
